meanings.definition: Able to adjust to new conditions or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The chameleon's adaptive skin color helps it blend into different environments.
meanings.sent2: She is an adaptive student who quickly learns new concepts.
meanings.sent3: The adaptive squirrel tried wearing sunglasses to adapt to the bright sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His adaptive mindset was like a flexible rubber band, always ready to stretch to new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The adaptive nature of the octopus amazed the marine biologist.

meanings.sent1: The team's adaptive strategy led them to victory in the game.

meanings.sent3: The adaptive cat decided to wear a tiny hat to show off its flexibility.
meanings.sent4: Her adaptive skills were like a well-oiled machine, smoothly adjusting to any situation.
meanings.sent5: The adaptive instincts of the wolf pack ensured their survival in the harsh winter.
